intro: Codonoboea crinita var. elongata, commonly known as the long-stemmed codonopsis, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its elongated, slender stems and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often in forest understories. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in partial shade.
